metadata.dc:author: Durán-Suárez, J R
Sánchez, C
Herrero, E
Hernández Sánchez, J M
metadata.dc:description: The first report of anti-Ge2 in our country, found in a Ge: -2, -3, A1B Rh+ patient is presented. The IgG + IgM antibody reacted in a low ionic strength medium, with a titre of 128. ABO compatible red blood cells labelled with 51Cr had a very shortened life span, with high haemolytic rate. The transfusion problems posed by this patient and the therapeutic autotransfusional approach carried out are commented.
metadata.dc:title: Anti-Ge2 en un paciente Ge: -2, -3.
[Anti-Ge2 in a Ge: -2, -3 patient].
